Class Encryptor

java.lang.Object
Encryptor
public class Encryptor
extends java.lang.Object
Encryptor contains is used to shift

  • Field Details

    • alphabet

      public static final char[] alphabet
      in order alphabet, every character is uppercase

  • Constructor Details

    • Encryptor

      public Encryptor​(java.lang.String fileName)
      Sets the filename
      Parameters:
      fileName - the desired name of the encryption file

  • Method Details

    • shiftMessage

      public static java.lang.String shiftMessage​(java.lang.String message, java.lang.String[] keyInfo, boolean decrypt)
      Shifts the given message based on the provided keyInfo. If decrypt is true, it will shift in the appropriate way for decryption. If false, it will shift for encryption. The message is shifted by shifting each individual letter
      Parameters:
      message - The message to be shifted
      keyInfo - String array containing the shift index and key values from the key file
      decrypt - true if decryption, false if encryption
      Returns:
      String of the shifted message

    • getFileInfo

      public static java.lang.String[] getFileInfo​(java.lang.String fileName)
      returns the information from a given fileName. If the fileName is not found, the output array will contain an error message
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the file to be read from
      Returns:
      String array containing the information from fileName

    • updateKeyFile

      public static java.lang.String updateKeyFile​(java.lang.String keyFileName, int newPos)
      Replaces the key file's old shift index with a new shift index
      Parameters:
      keyFileName - the name of the key file
      newPos - the position to replace the old position in the key file
      Returns:
      String displaying whether the file was successfully updated

    • createFile

      public java.lang.String createFile()
      Creates a file where the name is gotten from the instance variable fileName
      Returns:
      String message displaying whether the file was created successfully

    • writeToEncryptorFile

      public java.lang.String writeToEncryptorFile​(java.lang.String message)
      Uses a FileWriter object to write to encryptor file. The first line is the instance variable position, the second line is the inputted encrypted message.
      Parameters:
      message - the encrypted message to be written to the file
      Returns:
      String displaying whether the file was successfully written to

    • setPosition

      public void setPosition​(int position)
      sets the position
      Parameters:
      position - the desired position
